Teachers, are you intrigued by the idea of being a Multi-Classroom Leader (MCL)? Of career advancement with higher pay without leaving the classroom? We are offering teachers access to a special panel discussion tomorrow night, April 16, at 5:00 p.m. via Microsoft Teams. Hear from five current or former MCLs about their experiences in this role.

Join via the link or the phone number
+1 432-653-2986 United States, Odessa (Toll)
Conference ID: 206 979 046#

The Opportunity Culture structure is centered on the Multi-Classroom Leader (or MCL) – a highly effective teacher who leads a powerful campus team. MCLs provide intensive, day-to-day support, collaboration, and professional development to all members of the team – which helps with recruiting and retaining staff. Opportunity Culture works within the existing school budget to pay teacher-leaders more, making pay supplements sustainable. Student performance improves as highly effective teachers collaborate and reach more students every day.

Join this conversation tomorrow at 5:00 p.m.!

Today is Census Day. Please take just a few minutes for this video from the Census Bureau and to fill out your form. Your response is critical for our community.

The 2020 Census will provide a snapshot of our nation—who we are, where we live, and so much more.

The results will show where communities need new schools, new clinics, new roads, and more services for families, older adults, and children. The results will also inform how hundreds of billions of dollars in federal funding are allocated to more than 100 programs, including Medicaid, Head Start, block grants for community mental health services, and the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program, also known as SNAP.

The results of this once-a-decade count determine the number of seats each state has in the House of Representatives. They are also used to draw congressional and state legislative districts. Over the next decade, lawmakers, business owners, and many others will use 2020 Census data to make critical decisions.

Please respond today. You can visit my2020census.gov/.

Battle of the Bluebonnets

A 6-way tie for first place after regulation.
A 3-way tie for first place after two overtimes.
Eventually, the 5-student team from Burnet Elementary - ECISD prevailed as the 2020 champions of the Battle of the Bluebonnets. The members of the winning team are Jared Saucedo, Andrew, Brem, Arron Dameron, Navatiny Berry, Zaylee Lares, and Martin Valencia.
The Battle of the Bluebonnets is a fun, engaging, literacy event that started as an Education Foundation of Odessa grant and involves 26 elementary campuses. This program invites all ECISD students (grades 3-5) to read books on the Texas Bluebonnet Award list and then compete in a quiz-show where they test their knowledge on what they’ve read. Each school holds its own “battle” to determine which students will represent their campus at the District level.
The truth is, all of the kids from all of the elementary schools that participated won because they read a lot and competed well!

Promises Made, Promises Kept
We are approaching the one-year anniversary since our Ector County voters approved a Tax Ratification Election giving our school district more money for day-to-day operations. With guidance from a TRE Committee of community members, we developed a plan for 4 Priority Areas for this first year of that additional money.

At the time of the election, about 1/3 of the district’s fleet of buses was approaching or beyond its useful life (200,000 miles). With the funds from the successful TRE, we purchased 1 new activity bus (for extra-curricular trips), 8 new yellow buses and leased 30 new yellow buses. The new buses are equipped with seat belts and video cameras. All of the buses are in service now.

To keep up with all of the work already completed and more that is in progress, visit our Promises Made, Promises Kept web page - https://www.ectorcountyisd.org/Domain/187

Summer vacation is just getting started but Summer Registration will be here before you know it - and you can be ahead of the game! All returning ECISD students must fill out their registration forms online through the txConnect Parent Portal. Of course, the first step is to make sure you are signed up for the Parent Portal. You can get that Portal ID # from your campus. You only need one Parent Portal account but you do need an ID # for each of your children to access their records.

The steps to set up your Parent Portal account, registration dates and times, and registration requirements for RETURNING and NEW students can be found on our Registration web page - https://bit.ly/2sYNc2d

This summer, ECISD School Nutrition will, once again, connect children 18 years old and younger with healthy Summer Food Service Program (SFSP) meals at no cost to the child. SFSP is a U.S. Department of Agriculture nutrition program. For the children who rely on school meals during the academic year, these meals offer a source of good nutrition when school is out for the long summer vacation.

The meals will be served at the locations listed here. Dates and times vary for each site. The menus are also included here. There are no income requirements or registration. Any child under the age of 18 may come to eat. For more information, please contact the ECISD School Nutrition Department at 432-456-9749 or visit our website at www.ectorcountyisd.org/Domain/31.
